title: Homeopathy: the game is up
author: David Colquhoun
cleaned_text: I find quite astonishing the vituperation that is poured on Professor Ernst, simply because he assesses evidence with scrupulous fairness. The only people who would want to do that are those who don't like scrupulous fairness when it threatens to harm their income. Perhaps the homeopath, Stephen Gordon, should listen to what Michael Rawlins actually says, rather than the parody of it that has appeared in the media. He was referring to treatments that had already passed RCTs and saying that they should be followed up in the wider population of patients to see if they lived up to their initial promise. Homeopathic treatments have failed to show any initial promise when they have been tested properly. They can fairly be called the most discredited of all the widespread branches of CAM (I exclude crystal therapy and dowsing). For homeopaths, the game is up. That being the case it is not surprising that those who make a living from it have to resort to grasping at straws. I don't want to ban homeopaths, crystal therapists or any other sort of delusion, as long as they do no harm by pretending they can cure malaria or AIDS.
